headline: How to Watch Trump Michigan Rally: Time, Live Stream for GOP Event
author: Alexandra Hutzler
sentences: At the event, Trump continued to air grievances about the 2020 election by doubling down on his attacks on Georgia's top Republican leaders: Kemp and Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger.
According to the Free Press report, Washington Township officials are concerned that the rally will draw far more attendees than the building's 5,760 capacity, leading to safety concerns.
In attendance will be Kristina Karamo, who's seeking the Republican nomination for Michigan secretary of state, and Matt DePerno, who's running for state attorney general.
Ahead of Trump's arrival in the Wolverine State, Secretary of State Jocelyn Benson issued a warning about the ongoing threats to election integrity and security.
The former president is scheduled to stump for local Republican candidates at the Michigan Stars Sports Center in Washington Township on Saturday, April 2.
"The threats against our democracy are truly a five-alarm fire and in that fire, Michigan is ground zero," Benson told reporters earlier this week.
Benson, a Democrat, is Michigan's top election official and defended the state from Trump's attacks in the aftermath of his 2020 loss.
The former senator, ousted during a special runoff election last year, also vowed to ensure "whoever was responsible goes to jail."
Polls show Walker far ahead of the Republican field for Senate but Perdue lagging behind Kemp for the GOP nomination for governor.
Walker is running to unseat Democratic Senator Raphael Warnock while Perdue is challenging Republican Governor Brian Kemp.
Local officials in Michigan have expressed concerns about the logistics of Trump's rally, the Detroit Free Press reported.
"I do not want to allow it," Rob Schmelzer, the township's assistant fire chief and fire marshal, told the newspaper.
Last week, Trump traveled to Georgia to rally support for his two Republican picks: Herschel Walker and David Perdue.
Trump has claimed, without evidence, that the race was rigged despite hundreds of audits verifying the results.
Donald Trump will be in Michigan this weekend to address supporters ahead of the 2022 midterm elections.
Perdue also peddled Trump's election claims, stating that the 2020 races were "absolutely stolen."
Trump was the first Republican candidate for president to lose Georgia in nearly three decades.
"We need a landslide so big they can't rig it or steal it," Trump told the crowd.
The Trump campaign also lost several lawsuits in the state challenging ballots.
It will be streamed live on YouTube by the Right Side Broadcasting Network.
Trump called Kemp a "coward" for not overturning the results of the race.
President Joe Biden won Michigan by approximately 154,000 votes in 2020.
"I have nothing against the past president.
This has to do with the venue."
The rally kicks off at 7 p.m.
ET.
